displaytitle: Fragment of a hunt sarcophagus: head of a bearded man
medium: Proconnesian marble, bluish with dark veins
dimensions:
26.5 x 25.8 x 12.3 cm (10 7/16 x 10 3/16 x 4 13/16 in.)
d. of top molding 12.3 cm, h. of head 18.2 cm, h. of face 13.6 cm
creditline: Museum purchase, Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr., Memorial Collection Fund

titles.title: Fragment of a hunt sarcophagus: head of a bearded man

texts.textentryhtml: Acquired by by Sotheby Parke-Bernet from an unknown source, sold in 1982; acquired by Frederick H. Schultz, Class of 1976, between 1982 and 1993; purchased by the Museum (Carl Otto von Kienbusch, Jr., Memorial Collection Fund) in 1993 from Schultz.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1993", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 46-95.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1993", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 46-95., p. 82-83 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Egyptian, Middle Eastern, Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, also ancient glass and art reference books, (London: Sotheby Parke Bernet & Co., 1982).
bibliography.citation:
Egyptian, Middle Eastern, Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, also ancient glass and art reference books, (London: Sotheby Parke Bernet & Co., 1982).

, cat. no. 313

bibliography.boilertext: J. Michael Padgett, ed., Roman sculpture in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Art Museum, Princeton University,  2001).
bibliography.citation: J. Michael Padgett, ed., Roman sculpture in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Art Museum, Princeton University,  2001)., p. 161-163; cat. no. 45;

bibliography.boilertext: M. Fuchs, "Ein Fragment des Löwenjagdsarkophags München-Chapel Hill in Princeton: Zum Problem der Komposition," in Guntram Koch ed., Akten des Symposiums des Sarkophag-Corpus 2001, Marburg, 2.-7. Juli 2001, (Mainz am Rhein: P. von Zabern, 2008).
bibliography.citation: M. Fuchs, "Ein Fragment des Löwenjagdsarkophags München-Chapel Hill in Princeton: Zum Problem der Komposition," in Guntram Koch ed., Akten des Symposiums des Sarkophag-Corpus 2001, Marburg, 2.-7. Juli 2001, (Mainz am Rhein: P. von Zabern, 2008)., p. 13-21

caption: Roman, Severan Period (ca. 193–235 CE), ca. 270–280 CE, Fragment of a hunt sarcophagus: head of a bearded man. Proconnesian marble, bluish with dark veins; 26.5 x 25.8 x 12.3 cm. Museum purchase, Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr., Memorial Collection Fund (y1993-38)
